answerText: : closed/period orbits[10] This theorem predicts that in two dimensions, all trajectories go to a fixed point or a closed orbit. Crucially, it rules out the possibility of chaos in two dimensions.
heading: QUARK |2012 | 1 | 4 | Science | Math | College
subject: Science
question: Question: Bertrand's theorem states that only the coulomb and harmonic oscillator potentials can have elliptical closed types of these. For 10 points each: [10] Name these curves for a particle's trajectory.
